sentences.english: "No Man's Land" is traditionally known as the area between two trenches on a battlefield.
sentences.chinese: “無人區”往往指的是戰場上敵我壕溝之間的區域。

sentences.english: Makes yearly, mostly in the spring, trips on foot through inhospitable regions.
sentences.chinese: 每年，多爲夏季，在無人區徒步旅行。

sentences.english: He found himself back in that no-man's-land where we are neither asleep nor awake.
sentences.chinese: 他發現自己回到了那種似睡非睡的無人區。

sentences.english: Its ridiculous, and very dangerous for ships to enter this 'no man's land'.
sentences.chinese: 讓船隻進入這片“無人區”是荒謬且十分危險的。

pinyin: Xi3 ma3 la1 ya3 shan1 mai4

definition: Daxing'anling mountain range in northwest Heilongjiang province 黑龍江|黑龙江[Hei1 long2 jiang1] in northeast China/Daxing'anling prefecture
lit. men's footprints are rare (idiom)/fig. off the beaten track/lonely/deserted
to march straight in unchallenged (military) (idiom)/(fig.) to push deep into the heart of sth/to flood in
no sign of human habitation (idiom); desolate
to camp/to pitch camp/stationed/quartered/Taiwan pr. [zha2 ying2]
to pass over mountains ridges (idiom); fig. hardships of the journey
